categories.title: Weekly Open Source AI & Social Agents Updates

content.text: The latest 'What Did You Get Done This Week?' session invited contributors to share their updates on open-source AI and social agents. The session was recorded, transcribed, and shared for the community.
ELIZAOS 0.1.9 has been officially shipped! Special thanks to @spaceodili, @shakkernerd, and the entire open-source team for their contributions.
A new update has been made to the Volcengine model, adding model settings and improvements.
The Spanish version of the README has been added to the documentation to improve accessibility for Spanish-speaking developers.
The FAQ section has been updated to clarify the difference between clients and plugins, based on recent discussions in the community.
A minor fix was made to the Contributing Guide, correcting a broken link in the documentation.
A README file has been added for the Near plugin to improve documentation.
A bug fix was implemented to change the listening port from 80 to 3000 in the Docker configuration.
Support for the O1 model has been added to the js-tiktoken package, expanding its capabilities.
A new Massa plugin has been introduced, featuring a Transfer action.
A trading signals plugin has been added to the project.
Post-release fixes for ELIZAOS 0.1.9 include updates to logging levels, startup tips, and wallet address validation.
An update has been made to Deepseek, though specific details were not provided.
An unused package, 'solana-agentkit,' has been removed from the project.
Duplicate plugins have been removed from the project.
The ELIZAOS 0.1.9 release has been merged from the development branch to the main branch.

categories.title: Recent Bug Fixes and Improvements in ElizaOS

content.text: A bug was fixed where the GOOGLE_GENERATIVE_AI_API_KEY was not being passed correctly from the character file. This ensures that the API key is recognized when set in character secrets.

An issue causing double responses from the CONTINUE action in plugin-bootstrap was resolved. The fix ensures that the agent does not respond multiple times to the same message while maintaining the intended flow of conversation.
The transfer template of plugin-evm was tweaked to align with the correct chain naming conventions. This prevents errors when sending transactions using the agent.
A Gitpod installation bug was fixed to ensure that the install process ignores the lock file.
OpenAI and Vercel AI packages were upgraded to fix errors related to the `o1-preview` model. The update replaces the deprecated `max_tokens` parameter with `max_completion_tokens`.

Several AI and agent-focused hackathons are taking place, including Safe Agentathon (Feb 3-17, $250k prize), Sozu Hack (Jan 27-Feb 2), Agent Hackathon (Feb 14 deadline, $150k prize), and SUI AI Agent Hackathon (Feb 10 deadline, $100k prize).
Automation is advancing and may impact jobs in the near future.
AI agents will be developed from scratch in the near future.
A developer clarifies that they are not a key opinion leader (KOL) but gained followers due to their technical work.
A user confirms running their setup on a MacBook.
A refurbished ThinkPad is mentioned in a discussion.
A new feature has been introduced to integrate the Tavily SDK into the system. This enhancement aims to improve search capabilities by leveraging Tavily's JavaScript SDK.

Support for Azure models has been requested to enhance compatibility with Microsoft's AI ecosystem. This would allow seamless integration with Azure's model hosting, training, and inferencing tools, making it easier for organizations using Azure to deploy AI solutions.

A proposal has been made to integrate the Solana Agent Kit into the existing Solana plugin. This would expand the range of Solana-based actions that can be performed, improving support for various protocols on the blockchain.

Google Vertex AI has been added as a model inference provider. This feature allows users to deploy and manage models on Google Vertex AI, with support for various model types such as Gemini. The integration requires setting up environment variables and configuring Google Cloud credentials.

categories.title: Development Updates and Agentic Tech Opportunities

content.text: Amid market fluctuations, developers are encouraged to focus on building and leveraging new features and financial opportunities in agentic technology. Engaging with other builders is also emphasized.

Recent development efforts include package improvements, new features, and bug fixes. Notable work includes adding experimental telemetry model options, integrating the Tavily SDK, and updating the Volcengine model. A total of 20 contributors merged 13 pull requests.
A new feature update for the plugin-coinmarketcap has been introduced, addressing issue #3133. The update includes tests and improvements with low associated risks.
A new feature update for the plugin-coingecko has been released, focusing on test configuration and coverage. This update addresses issue #3123 and has low associated risks.

categories.title: AI-Powered News Aggregator and DAO Updates

content.text: The AI news aggregator is being actively developed with new plugins added, including an arbitrage plugin for cross-DEX trading, a Mind Network plugin for enhanced AI capabilities, a Zilliqa blockchain plugin, a Hyperbolic plugin for autonomous GPU management, and an APRO plugin for coin-related functionalities.

Upcoming improvements focus on refining data and frontends, including enhancements to the dashboard, newsletter site, AI news show, and historical news aggregator. AI agents will be loaded with FAQs and news, with Eliza agents set to tweet and reply to updates. Collaboration and bounty opportunities are available.

The automated DAO news system is progressing well, with an improved AI news aggregator in production. A sample weekly newsletter has been generated, along with a weekly X thread generator (though no agents are active yet). Montages and 3D AI TV news slides are now easier to create, showing strong potential for the system.
A user expressed their goal of getting Eliza-related applications featured on the OpenRouter showcase leaderboard.
A discussion emerged regarding support for different Eliza community teams, with one user defending their choice and criticizing certain games.

A new pull request was submitted to the Eliza framework repository, adding AI-generated README documentation for plugins. The documentation includes sections such as installation, configuration, usage, security best practices, and troubleshooting. This update aims to improve accessibility for new developers.

categories.title: Enhancements to Knowledge System and PostgreSQL SSL Support

content.text: A new feature has been introduced to separate the knowledge system from the memories table, allowing better management and segregation of knowledge. This update also enables multiple agents to share knowledge, reducing duplication and optimizing performance. Users can now create a 'knowledge' folder within their character directory, storing text or markdown files that can be referenced without pasting their full contents. All database adapters have been updated to support new functions for managing knowledge. Minimal documentation updates are required to explain how to enable the new RAG knowledge system.

A new SSL flag has been added to support both local and remote PostgreSQL database connections. The update ensures that when connecting to an RDS PostgreSQL instance, SSL is handled correctly by checking if the connection string includes 'localhost'. If not, SSL is enabled with 'rejectUnauthorized: false'. This change allows seamless switching between local and remote database instances. Automated tests confirm the functionality, and minimal documentation updates are required.

categories.title: Recent Issues and Fixes in ElizaOS

content.text: A critical error was identified and fixed in the ElizaOS project. The issue was caused by not adding a CommonJS module to external modules, which led to bundling problems.
A setup failure was reported in the ElizaOS starter project due to missing module declarations. The error occurred during the DTS build process, preventing successful installation and execution.

A strange fetch behavior was observed when attempting to upload images to Twitter using ElizaOS. Despite correct implementation, the system returned a 'media parameter is missing' error. Debugging showed that the same code worked outside of ElizaOS, suggesting a possible issue with how fetch is handled within the framework.
We bring up anyone that requests to speak.
Honestly this is the best PR.
